intro: Galium bifolium, commonly known as lesser bedstraw, is a low-growing herbaceous plant native to temperate regions of the Northern Hemisphere. It features slender, hairy stems that often lie close to the ground, forming dense mats. The plant has opposite, ovate leaves that are usually hairy on both surfaces, and small, white to pale pink flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. It is often found in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. Galium bifolium is a member of the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants.
